sentence.Network_en: Many of these killers are frequently glib and superficially charming.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些杀手中，多数都是能说会道、外表迷人。

sentence.Network_en: Superficially there have been many changes in Britain in recent years.
sentence.Network_cn: 近几年来英国的面貌发生了很多变化。

sentence.Network_en: The film touches on these difficult questions, but only superficially.
sentence.Network_cn: 这部电影触及了这些难题，但只是蜻蜓点水式的。

entry.tran: 肤浅的;浅薄的;粗枝大叶的
entry.def: If you describe someone as superficial, you disapprove of them because they do not think deeply, and have little understanding of anything serious or important.

example.ex: This guy is a superficial yuppie with no intellect whatsoever...
example.tran: 这个家伙是个肤浅的雅皮士，没有什么头脑。

example.ex: The tone of his book is consistently negative, occasionally arrogant, and often superficial.
example.tran: 他的书基调一贯是负面消极的，有时还有点儿傲慢自大，且常常流于肤浅。

entry.tran: (行动、情感、关系)表面的，外表的，不深入的
entry.def: If you describe something such as an action, feeling, or relationship as superficial, you mean that it includes only the simplest and most obvious aspects of that thing, and not those aspects which require more effort to deal with or understand.

example.ex: Their arguments do not withstand the most superficial scrutiny...
example.tran: 他们的论据经不起一点推敲。

example.ex: His roommate had been pleasant on a superficial level...
example.tran: 他的舍友只是表面上装和气。

entry.tran: 表面的，乍看起来的(尤指实际并非如此)
entry.def: Superficial is used to describe the appearance of something or the impression that it gives, especially if its real nature is very different.

example.ex: Despite these superficial resemblances, this is a darker work than her earlier novels...
example.tran: 尽管表面上有一些相似之处，但这本著作实际要比她以前的小说悲观。

example.ex: Spain may well look different but the changes are superficial.
example.tran: 西班牙可能看起来与以前有很大不同，但这些变化都是表面上的。

entry.tran: (伤势或伤害)表层的，表皮的，表面的
entry.def: Superficial injuries are not very serious, and affect only the surface of the body. You can also describe damage to an object as superficial .

example.ex: The 69-year-old clergyman escaped with superficial wounds...
example.tran: 69 岁的牧师幸免于难，只受了点皮肉伤。

example.ex: The explosion caused superficial damage to the fortified house.
example.tran: 这次爆炸只对这所加固过的房屋造成了轻微破坏。

entry.def: The superficial layers of the skin are the ones nearest the surface.

auth_sentence.content: Superficially the obvious alternative to chance is an intelligent Designer.
auth_sentence.res_content: Superficially the obvious alternative to chance is an intelligent Designer.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Superficially the obvious alternative to chance is an intelligent Designer.

auth_sentence.content: The effect is superficially attractive but unsatisfying.
auth_sentence.res_content: The effect is superficially attractive but unsatisfying.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The effect is superficially attractive but unsatisfying.

auth_sentence.content: I know quite a lot of things superficially but nothing really well.
auth_sentence.res_content: I know quite a lot of things superficially but nothing really well.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I know quite a lot of things superficially but nothing really well.

sentences.cn: 这两项声明表面上一致。
他们的经历从表面看很相似。

sentences.en: We must on no account view problems superficially and in isolation.
sentences.cn: 我们绝不能表面地、孤立地看问题。
